page.title: 19LEEK TOWN DESCRIBED
page.content: Leek is a market town of about 20,000 in the centre of the Staffordshire Moorlands.Its a textile town nestling in a valley surrounded by hills like the Roaches and unspoilt countryside.It has much fine architechture and an ancient parish church.There is alot of new housing with plenty of pleasant country views;a pleasant expanse of park land.There are squash courts and a swimming pool.It boasts a number of very old coaching inns and ample opportunities for refreshments in the pleasant pubs and cafes.It is an ideal centre for touring and exploring nearby Macclesfierld,Ashbourne,Buxton and the Potteries.
